item.title: Owning My Words
item.description: I’ve had this little website for almost three years and only made a handful of posts. There are other platforms with websites and apps that don’t require me to create new Markdown files via CLI and rebuild and push a website. They also have much wider reach - immeasurably so. As the sands of the internet continue to shift, one may want to ask the questions “are those advantages?” and “are they enough?

item.title: AccessibleDocTool - creating accessible documents
item.description: I’ve gotten involved in a few different activities that warrant the creation of documents that are accessible to blind and visually impaired people. In general, that means careful font and visual style selection, for better visual readability, and proper use of semantics and structure, for screen reader use. It’s also a good idea to provide different file formats - different strokes for different folks, right? That either sounds like a lot of work, or like a task that’s a perfect candidate for templates and automation.

item.title: eul
item.description: This week, I localized eul into Portuguese. It’s a system monitor for macOS that supports Big Sur, including some nice widgets.

item.title: Rectangle
item.description: Last week, I contributed a Portuguese (Portugal) localization to the Rectangle app. It’s a window manager for macOS and I highly recommend it!
